definition: formidable opponent
stalwart/sturdy/strong/powerful
strength/energy/enthusiasm/spirit/mood/expression/interest/CL:把[ba3]/Taiwan pr. [jing4]
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Kitano musashi narrates the sea, how to lose how encounter tikal emperor god crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 北野武藏敘說海上如何遭遇勁敵，如何失去天皇神弩。

sentences.english: He got his men into a tight huddle before they took on arch-rivals Spain.
sentences.chinese: 在面臨勁敵西班牙之前，他召集他的人開了一個短會。

sentences.english: So far, the two sides have been arch- enemies.
sentences.chinese: 迄今爲止，雙方已成爲勁敵。

sentences.english: Television has proved a tough competitor for advertising to the newspaper industry.
sentences.chinese: 在廣告電視表明是報刊業的勁敵。

sentences.english: But India takes a dim view of China's cooperation with archrival Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 不過，印度對中國與其勁敵巴基斯坦的合作不以爲然。

sentences.english: This makes Google into Apple’s archrival in a way it never was before.
sentences.chinese: 這讓谷歌成爲蘋果前所未有的勁敵。

sentences.english: With this, they represent Islam as if it is an arch-enemy of advancement and progress.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做，只是在把伊斯蘭描述爲進步與發展的勁敵。

sentences.english: Host beach spikers turn formidable rivals to topple in the Asian Games.
sentences.chinese: 亞運會上，東道主的沙灘排球選手擊垮了他們的勁敵。

definition: to compete for first prize
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
unprecedented/never seen before
Waterloo (Belgium)/Battle of Waterloo (1815)/fig. a defeat/failure
film director
out of the ordinary
lit. to thread a needle (idiom); fig. to act as a go-between
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to be determined to win (idiom)
Mike (name)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
